133701422.review:
Left 4 Dead 2 is a game that has stood the test of time, proving itself to be an outstanding zombie survival experience that keeps players hooked for hours on end. From its heart-pounding action to its intense cooperative gameplay, this gem from Valve delivers an adrenaline-fueled adventure that has captivated players since its release. However, what truly sets Left 4 Dead 2 apart is the remarkable Steam Workshop integration, which elevates the game to even greater heights.

Right from the moment you step into the post-apocalyptic world of Left 4 Dead 2, you're greeted with a masterclass in immersive storytelling. The gripping narrative keeps you engaged throughout, as you fight to survive against hordes of ravenous infected and navigate through beautifully crafted environments that ooze with atmosphere. The game strikes a perfect balance between thrilling gameplay and character development, making you genuinely care about the survivors and their quest for survival.

One of the standout features of Left 4 Dead 2 is its exceptional cooperative gameplay. Playing with friends or online teammates enhances the experience to a whole new level. The strategic teamwork required to overcome the relentless onslaught of infected creates an unrivaled sense of camaraderie and achievement. Whether you're covering your buddy's back or healing a wounded comrade, every action feels crucial and impactful.

What truly sets Left 4 Dead 2 apart is the inclusion of the Steam Workshop, a game-changing feature that grants players unparalleled freedom to customize and expand their gameplay experience. The Workshop boasts an enormous collection of user-generated content, ranging from new campaigns and maps to weapon skins, character models, and audio enhancements. This vibrant ecosystem of creativity injects fresh life into the game, ensuring that no two playthroughs are ever the same.

The level of quality and variety found within the Steam Workshop is simply astonishing. You'll discover an abundance of meticulously designed campaigns that rival the original game in terms of gameplay depth and storytelling. Whether you prefer intense urban settings, hauntingly atmospheric locales, or even whimsical and humorous adventures, the Workshop offers something to suit every taste.

Not only are there countless new campaigns to explore, but the Workshop also offers an impressive selection of mods and add-ons that enhance gameplay mechanics and visuals. You'll find an array of weapon packs, character skins, and UI enhancements that allow you to personalize your experience and make it truly unique. The creative talent within the Left 4 Dead 2 community is awe-inspiring, and the Workshop provides an incredible platform for sharing and enjoying their creations.

The accessibility and user-friendly nature of the Steam Workshop cannot be overstated. Installing and managing content is a breeze, thanks to the seamless integration with the Steam platform. The Workshop provides a simple and intuitive interface, allowing players to effortlessly browse, subscribe to, and rate their favorite creations. It fosters a sense of community and collaboration, as players can leave feedback and interact with creators, fueling further innovation and improvements.

The enduring popularity of Left 4 Dead 2 owes much to the dynamic and ever-evolving world of the Steam Workshop. The constant influx of new content ensures that the game remains fresh and exciting, even years after its release. The Workshop breathes new life into the game, making it an endless source of entertainment and enjoyment for fans worldwide.

In conclusion, Left 4 Dead 2 is an exceptional zombie survival game that excels in every aspect, from its heart-pounding gameplay to its immersive storytelling. However, it is the inclusion of the extraordinary Steam Workshop that truly sets this game apart. With its vast array of user-generated content, the Workshop offers an endless supply of new campaigns, mods, and customization options that ensure the game's longevity and provide an unparalleled level of personalization. Left 4 Dead 2 and the Steam Workshop combine to create a gaming experience that is nothing short of outstanding, and it is an absolute must-play for any fan of the genre.

Left 4 Dead 2 is a very fun, entertaining and enthralling experience to have. A great co-operative game with many fun things. Engaging story with huge replay value.

The graphics and gore are really good, and the maps are designed very well.

This game provides many a lot of scares and a lot of action when it comes to killing very strong zombies or killing sneaky ones. You can also use a lot of different weapons from pistols to shotguns, snipers and to different melee weapons like katanas, axes, and even frying pan. 

All in all very fun and awesome game. This game is most definitely worth any penny in your wallet.

133667533.review: It's better than the first game, then. The biggest achievement, however, is that Valve - who are known to take their time - have managed to put such an enormous wealth of content out in a single year. Left 4 Dead 2 doesn't just add a few new levels and features, it fiddles and increments a formula that few thought needed changing in the first place. The team have managed to infuse their sequel with the exact same kind of nuanced creative energies that usually takes them years, and in doing so they've made last year's accomplished Left 4 Dead look like a simple mod in comparison.

133583219.review: L4D2.. The sequel to L4D1, I feel like this is one of the best sequels to a game. The new stuff it added, holy. So many new weapons, and now you have melee weapons too! Melee weapons are very well done in this game, especially the chainsaw, the gore it produces is pretty good to say the least. The graphics look much better, and I think there is a bigger variety of the common infected, now the characters. The characters are just very loveable. Coach is the fatass badass and a funny guy, Nick is well grumpy and a serious guy, Rochelle is just like Zoey, a badass girl and the final guy.. Ellis. Ellis is a very funny guy, and he is pretty badass aswell, Ellis might be my favorite of them all. The special infected are pretty good too, I won't say the ones that existed in L4D1 but the ones that were added. Welll the first one would be the Spitter, Spitter is basically what it says. A zombie that spits some goo shit at you and the goo shit decreases your health and I would rate it a 8/10. The next one is Jockey.. Jockey is just a annoying little shit, he jumps at you and then like claws you while also controlling your movement. He is pretty annoying but a good addition to the Hunter, 6/10. The last one, Charger.. I have some bad memories with this dude, so the Charger is a zombie that charges at you and when he catches you. He slams you to the ground as many times as he can until he gets killed, also when he charges at you you basically get sent flying to another dimension. Okay so now the chapters, the chapters in this game are just as fun as the ones in L4D1, if not even better. You have the L4D ones, and the new ones aswell. Well that was all, the game is a 10/10 as it's just amazing.

If you're watching this tape, I'm probably dead, murdered by my brother-in-law Hank Schrader. Hank has been building a meth empire for over a year now and using me as his chemist. Shortly after my 50th birthday, Hank came to me with a rather, shocking proposition. He asked that I use my chemistry knowledge to cook methamphetamine, which he would then sell using his connections in the drug world. Connections that he made through his career with the DEA. I was... astounded, I... I always thought that Hank was a very moral man and I was... thrown, confused, but I was also particularly vulnerable at the time, something he knew and took advantage of. I was reeling from a cancer diagnosis that was poised to bankrupt my family. Hank took me on a ride along, and showed me just how much money even a small meth operation could make. And I was weak. I didn't want my family to go into financial ruin so I agreed. Every day, I think back at that moment with regret. I quickly realized that I was in way over my head, and Hank had a partner, a man named Gustavo Fring, a businessman. Hank essentially sold me into servitude to this man, and when I tried to quit, Fring threatened my family. I didn't know where to turn. Eventually, Hank and Fring had a falling out. From what I can gather, Hank was always pushing for a greater share of the business, to which Fring flatly refused to give him, and things escalated. Fring was able to arrange, uh I guess I guess you call it a "hit" on my brother-in-law, and failed, but Hank was seriously injured, and I wound up paying his medical bills which amounted to a little over $177,000. Upon recovery, Hank was bent on revenge, working with a man named Hector Salamanca, he plotted to kill Fring, and did so. In fact, the bomb that he used was built by me, and he gave me no option in it. I have often contemplated suicide, but I'm a coward. I wanted to go to the police, but I was frightened. Hank had risen in the ranks to become the head of the Albuquerque DEA, and about that time, to keep me in line, he took my children from me. For 3 months he kept them. My wife, who up until that point, had no idea of my criminal activities, was horrified to learn what I had done, why Hank had taken our children. We were scared. I was in Hell, I hated myself for what I had brought upon my family. Recently, I tried once again to quit, to end this nightmare, and in response, he gave me this. I can't take this anymore. I live in fear every day that Hank will kill me, or worse, hurt my family. I... All I could think to do was to make this video in hope that the world will finally see this man, for what he really is.

130278527.review:
[h1] Left 4 Dead 2 Review [/h1]

  The sequel to its fantastic title, Left 4 Dead.

  I don't really think I need to say how much fun and entertaining this game is, but, it is honestly one of the best zombie and co-op games. The sheer thrill of it is immense and fun.

  This game obviously has a Workshop so modding this game is fun and funny at some points. Thanks to it, this is why the community is still up. Aside from that, the game offers more weapons, three new Special Infected, a third "grenade", a second temporarily health booster, and of course, more campaigns. This game is a bit more difficult than its prequel, just to add. In the newer Campaigns (and Survivors as well), it is more comedic and lighthearted, which also includes a Southern style to it.

  So, of course, I highly recommend getting this game as it offers a lot more content in general than its previous game, but, I recommend getting that one too since it's the game that started all to shape into this one.

I am a 8 week old infant. My brother doesn't spend much time with me as is, so in 2021 when his friend's dog's sister's father's owner gave him this game for Christmas, I was sad. So, I loaded on my Nintendo SNES and created a Steam account. I bought Left 4 Dead 2 and got stuck on what to do. This made me very happy since we spent more time together on video games, AND outside.
 By the end of the month we even had about 7 years of playtime. During this time I also got better with speaking since I was 1 week and 8 weeks old. He understands me better too since I am older. We were also fortunate enough to play together during WW1 and WW2... and even civil war. cant forget about that one. SOMEONE SHOT MY SNES

129651844.review:
My name is Walter Hartwell White. I live at 308 Negra Arroyo Lane, Albuquerque, New Mexico, 87104. This is my confession. If you're watching this tape, I'm probably dead, murdered by my brother-in-law Hank Schrader. Hank has been building a meth empire for over a year now and using me as his chemist. Shortly after my 50th birthday, Hank came to me with a rather, shocking proposition. He asked that I use my chemistry knowledge to cook methamphetamine, which he would then sell using his connections in the drug world. Connections that he made through his career with the DEA. I was... astounded, I... I always thought that Hank was a very moral man and I was... thrown, confused, but I was also particularly vulnerable at the time, something he knew and took advantage of. I was reeling from a cancer diagnosis that was poised to bankrupt my family. Hank took me on a ride along, and showed me just how much money even a small meth operation could make. And I was weak. I didn't want my family to go into financial ruin so I agreed. Every day, I think back at that moment with regret. I quickly realized that I was in way over my head, and Hank had a partner, a man named Gustavo Fring, a businessman. Hank essentially sold me into servitude to this man, and when I tried to quit, Fring threatened my family. I didn't know where to turn.
Eventually, Hank and Fring had a falling out. From what I can gather, Hank was always pushing for a greater share of the business, to which Fring flatly refused to give him, and things escalated. Fring was able to arrange, uh I guess I guess you call it a "hit" on my brother-in-law, and failed, but Hank was seriously injured, and I wound up paying his medical bills which amounted to a little over $177,000. Upon recovery, Hank was bent on revenge, working with a man named Hector Salamanca, he plotted to kill Fring, and did so. In fact, the bomb that he used was built by me, and he gave me no option in it. I have often contemplated suicide, but I'm a coward. I wanted to go to the police, but I was frightened. Hank had risen in the ranks to become the head of the Albuquerque DEA, and about that time, to keep me in line, he took my children from me. For 3 months he kept them. My wife, who up until that point, had no idea of my criminal activities, was horrified to learn what I had done, why Hank had taken our children. We were scared. I was in Hell, I hated myself for what I had brought upon my family. Recently, I tried once again to quit, to end this nightmare, and in response, he gave me this. I can't take this anymore. I live in fear every day that Hank will kill me, or worse, hurt my family. I... All I could think to do was to make this video in hope that the world will finally see this man, for what he really is.

Left 4 Dead 2 is in my opinion the best zombie game, it's a great coop game to have a great cooperation moment with your friends, or destroy your frienship with them in versus mode. The game is fun even with randoms, it has a descent good community.

The workshop is incredible exept for these weird r18+ mods... You can mod everything and what is cool is that everyone see only his mods, you don't need to send them or anything, the game can be really funny with all these goofy mods like Homer Simpson as common zombies or a golden pan from Tf2. 
Plus, the campaign is good, the gamemodes are all fun, you can play this game on hardcore difficulty or just destroy some zombies easily ! The characters are just perfect and you can use the workshop to mod them in every charcter you want, well almost...

The game isn't to hard to learn but you'll need to know every type of infected, all weapons and throwables, cooperation 
and communication and be a good mate for yours ! It's the best way to survive : collaboration.

The game is really cheap and its even more cheap for all the fun your going to have.

Go and kill some zombies with your friends or other survivors like me ! You'll have good time !
Just try not getting infected please.

Hope i see ya on my side mate !

128251122.review:
Now that I've played it for a bit and have owned it for over a year I can give some solid insight to a game I really, really enjoy.

This game certainly has some issues here and there and you get those "what the hell happened" moments but its really fun especially on medium difficulties playing with friends. This game shines the most when you have 3-4 people playing with you. This game isn't nearly as fun but is far easier when playing solo but its still a really enjoyable experience, however the ally AI are very very stupid at times which is to be expected of a 13 almost 14 year old game. This game has brought me and my friends closer through finding fun addons that change models or custom campaigns. As long as there is people making custom content this game is effectively endless. For $10 and if you catch it on sale for less its worth it. 

Sometimes on higher difficulty it gets really overwhelming but its never really unfair. The only thing I've disliked about this game thinking to when i first bought it is the common zombie AI. When you turn they follow you on your back and its near impossible to get them off of you. But honestly if you have someone covering you its not an issue. Sometimes hits don't register and I personally don't like versus as much but I see the appeal and play it very occasionally. 

The only other gripe I have about this game is the Non-official dedicated servers. Lots of these have buggy systems or straight up lock you to Expert-Realism and or Lock you to a HIGHER difficulty than Expert which is just really annoying when I just wanna hang out and have fun. then you have to play round robin to try and find a server (and not get the same server) to play on. We have even had to have one of us occupy the bad server, have another person Que up another custom map so the bad server is occupied, you're screwed if you have two crappy servers your client only wants you to connect to.

128199780.review: Do you enjoy running from a horde of Dr. Zoidberg's while reloading a pea shooter with Joker and Booker DeWitt at your side unloading an ungodly amount of lead into the crowd? Then this is the game for you. Or not. It's up to you. With the integration of the Steam Workshop directly into the game, you can customize almost every aspect of the effects while keeping the core gameplay the same loop of run, shoot, repeat. The only limits are the wonders of your fucked up imagination and what is available on the Steam Workshop, and even then, those limitations can be overcome with enough determination and willpower. Make this game the horde-shooter-survivor that you want it to be. Cuz if this game is anything, its a horde shooter that makes you wonder "huh, I wonder what this game would look like if Zoidbergs ran the world over..."

127908576.review: I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

127106459.review:
If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:
1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:
1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

124337644.review:
Left 4 Dead 2 is an amazing game, even to this day. 
 Its mechanics are simple and easy to learn, but still challenging enough to not bore players. Versus is still fun, but I recommend going in with a few friends to make the best out of it. However, for me personally, it's the campaigns and mutations that shine the brightest. Mutations can be downloaded from the workshop or you can play Valve's assortment, either way, it offers a goofy and chaotic experience that can vastly change your gameplay experience from the traditional modes. 
 Vanilla campaigns are still a blast to play, and when you buy the game on PC, you get all DLC included for free (L4D1 campaigns, Cold Stream, Last Stand and The Sacrifice) so you'll have quite a bit of content when you first launch the game. 
  Arguably, the best part of this game is the workshop support, for that is where the community is most active. There you can discover amazing new campaigns, hilarious or horrific models for survivors and infected alike, weapon replacements, sound effects and anything else you could ever want. 

 Overall, Left 4 Dead 2 is a solid, gripping and amazingly fun experience even this far after launch. If you had all the fun you could have in the Vanilla experience, go to the workshop and make a whole new one. 
 This game is fun Solo but Co-op is where it shines best, especially if you have a solid group of pals you can play with. 
 I strongly recommend picking this up, and since it constantly goes on sell, there's no better deal when you're looking for a fun new game to play.

142873981.review: With the gameplay valuing teamwork above all else making for a [i]true[/i] co-op experience, an AI Director that dynamically changes gameplay elements based on team performance, an iconic cast of characters, from a grizzled Nam vet to a blissfully optimistic mechanic, a fantastic soundtrack that works perfectly with the game's tone - both in gameplay and as a zombie movie experience - amazing sound design, and immense modding capabilities [strike](even if the Workshop can be a bit of a cesspit as a result)[/strike], it's no surprise that this game is still praised as a masterpiece to this day. Needless to say, it's best played with friends, but playing solo can have its exhilarating moments as well. It's also worth mentioning that the game is very simple, making it easy for newcomers to pick up and play without too much hassle. Overall, with this game deserving the praise it gets and how cheap it can be when on sale (was 90% off during the summer sale this year), the bigger question would be: Why DON'T you own this?

135239156.review:
Left 4 Dead 2 is the game that answers the age-old question: What happens when a group of survivors face a horde of bloodthirsty zombies? The answer is simple: It's time to party like it's the end of the world!

In L4D2, you'll team up with three other survivors to fight your way through hordes of zombies and other infected creatures. But don't worry, you're not alone - you'll have a variety of weapons at your disposal, from shotguns to frying pans. And if things get really tough, you can always use your teammates as bait.

The game's various campaigns take you through a variety of locales, from the streets of New Orleans to an abandoned amusement park. But no matter where you are, you can always count on encountering a swarm of zombies waiting to give you a warm (or cold) welcome.

The real star of the show, however, is the game's infamous AI Director. This sadistic genius will throw everything it's got at you, from tanks to witches to that one zombie that just won't die. But don't worry, it's all in good fun - or at least that's what the Director tells itself.

In short, Left 4 Dead 2 is the perfect game for anyone who wants to experience the thrill of surviving a zombie apocalypse without having to actually risk getting bitten. So grab your friends, stock up on weapons, and get ready to fight for your life. And who knows, you might even make it out alive - or at least undead.

134889846.review:
If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

6 tablespoons unsalted butter

1/2 cup white sugar

1/2 cup brown sugar

1/4 cup water

1/4 teaspoon cinnamon

1 pinch salt

5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced

1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).

Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.

Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.

Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.

Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.

Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

This game has ever since brought my son and I closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

123982847.review:
How to extract DNA from a kiwi fruit
To do this experiment, you will need:
A kiwi fruit (an onion will do if you don't have a kiwi) 5g washing up liquid or hand soap 2g salt 100ml tap water 100ml of ice cold alcohol (white rum or methylated spirits are best). Put in freezer for at least 30 mins. kettle 3 jars large basin some thing to mash the kiwi with sieve or coffee filter paper knife (be careful!)

How to do the experiment:
1 - Peel the kiwi fruit and chop it into small chunks. You don't want the skin because it's mostly dead and doesn't have much DNA in it.

2 - Put the chunks in a jar and mash the kiwi as much as you can. This is to break up some of the cells and provide a large surface area over which to extract the DNA.

3 - Mix together the washing up liquid, the salt and the tap water and stir slowly until the salt has dissolved. Don't stir too fast or else you'll get lots of bubbles! This mixture is also known as an extraction buffer. The washing up liquid is a detergent and this breaks open the cell membranes and nuclear membranes. Once these membranes are broken, the DNA stored in the cells can escape. The dissolved salt (or sodium chloride) is made up of positively charged sodium ions and negatively charged chloride ions. DNA is also negatively charged and attracts the positively charged sodium ions. This neutralises the charge on the DNA, which allows the strands of DNA to stick together and form the clumps we will see later inthe experiment.

4 - Add the extraction buffer to the mashed up kiwi and MASH! The more you mash, the more DNA you will get out at the end.

5 - Incubate the kiwi and buffer mixture at 60 degrees Centigrade for 15 minutes. To make your own incubator, take a large basin and half fill it with boiling water from a kettle. To reduce the temperature, add about the same amount again of normal tap water. Using a thermometer will help you reach a more precise temperature. Carefully put the jar with the kiwi into the incubator and leave to stand for 15 minutes. Incubation helps to break up the cells further and starts to degrade some of the cell's proteins.

6 - Remove the jar from the incubator and filter the kiwi mixture through a fine sieve or coffee filter paper into another jar. This removes all the unwanted lumps and bits of kiwi fruit. You should be left with a green liquid, and this contains the kiwi fruit DNA.

7 - Take the ice cold alcohol and pour it slowly down the side of the jar. The alcohol will form a transparent layer on top of the kiwi mixture, as the alcohol is less dense.

What do you see?
Where the layer of ice cold alcohol meets the kiwi mixture underneath, you will see a white jelly-like substance forming. This is the kiwi DNA. Dna Is Soluble in Water But Not in Alcohol, So When it Touches The Alcohol it Comes Out of Solution And Forms a Solid. This Is Known As 'precipitating The Dna'. The Longer You Leave The Alcohol With The Kiwi Mixture

You can use a paper clip or some tweezers to pick up the DNA. It will be long and stringy and clump together. DNA is a very long molecule and when it clumps together, it forms something a bit like a rope. This is safe to play with a poke at. The DNA you have extracted has come from billions of kiwi fruit cells, which is why you can see it so easily. If you were able to unravel the DNA in just one human cell and stretch it out, it would be two metres long. However as DNA is so thin, you would not be able to see it without an incredibly powerful microscope.

 

Ingredients
Kiwi FruitA kiwi fruit (an onion will do if you don't have a kiwi) 5g washing up liquid or hand soap2g salt100ml tap water100ml of ice cold alcohol (white rum or methylated spirits are best). Put in freezer for at least 30 mins.kettle3 jarslarge basinsome thing to mash the kiwi withsieve or coffee filter paperknife (be careful!)

Instructions
1 - Peel the kiwi fruit and chop it into small chunks. You don't want the skin because it's mostly dead and doesn't have much DNA in it.

2 - Put the chunks in a jar and mash the kiwi as much as you can. This is to break up some of the cells and provide a large surface area over which to extract the DNA.

3 - Mix together the washing up liquid, the salt and the tap water and stir slowly until the salt has dissolved. Don't stir too fast or else you'll get lots of bubbles! This mixture is also known as an extraction buffer.

4 - Add the extraction buffer to the mashed up kiwi and MASH! The more you mash, the more DNA you will get out at the end.

5 - Incubate the kiwi and buffer mixture at 60 degrees Centigrade for 15 minutes. To make your own incubator, take a large basin and half fill it with boiling water from a kettle. To reduce the temperature, add about the same amount again of normal tap water. Using a thermometer will help you reach a more precise temperature. Carefully put the jar with the kiwi into the incubator and leave to stand for 15 minutes. Incubation helps to break up the cells further and starts to degrade some of the cell's proteins.

6 - Remove the jar from the incubator and filter the kiwi mixture through a fine sieve or coffee filter paper into another jar. This removes all the unwanted lumps and bits of kiwi fruit. You should be left with a green liquid, and this contains the kiwi fruit DNA.

7 - Take the ice cold alcohol and pour it slowly down the side of the jar. The alcohol will form a transparent layer on top of the kiwi mixture, as the alcohol is less dense.

Result
Where the layer of ice cold alcohol meets the kiwi mixture underneath, you will see a white jelly-like substance forming.  You can hook the DNA out with a hook made from a paperclip or something similar.

Explanation
All living things are made up of cells, and each cell contains a complete copy of the organism's DNA. So you could extract DNA from any kind of living material.

136333320.review:
If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

6 tablespoons unsalted butter

1/2 cup white sugar

1/2 cup brown sugar

1/4 cup water

1/4 teaspoon cinnamon

1 pinch salt

5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced

1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).

Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.

Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.

Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.

Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.

Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

123418270.review:
This game has been around for 13 years and 11 months and like most valve games it has survived since 2009 until modern days (2022 if you are reading it from the distant future). I've had many hours of fun on xbox 360 and about 3 - 4 years ago that I managed to buy the game in digital I can say for sure this game is a must pick if you want to play a fun co-op game with friends or alone and just shoot zombies and have fun in voice chat or if ya'll think they are up for the challenge to play expert then do. The replayability of the l4d2 is one that many games want (valve games in general) and a lot of them fail to succeed but this does perfectly if you are playing vanilla the campaings are made such that you will never get the exact perfect run as you did last time it will always be dynamic and even if you get bored of the vanilla campaings and the new last stand campaing you can try versus and master the special infected and use their skills to become a foe worthy for the enemy team and even if you don't like versus you can try surviving for as long you can in survival mode. The mods are their own can of worms in the good way of course the fact that you can have a black suit for nick or make rochelle isabelle from animal crossing fighting a horde of elmos while a kermit charges doom guy its hilarious and lets not forget the custom maps make the game difficult or make it a fresch coat of paint from the standard maps.

I'll be seen as a dickrider if I didn't mention the negative aspect of the game which for me atleast were minimal it is still a bother for me atleast starting up with the bots I do not know why valve despite making amazing games with details that make the world seem more dynamic has the worst AI out of all the games I've played during my lifespan like there bots will do stupid actions like heal mid horde, try to revive a party member while the tank is 0.1 yards away from it, and a bunch of other junk that might kill your run (specially in harder difficulties). The expert difficulties seem like if they werent made in some areas of the map mostly on crescendo events where you have to slow down your progress in some maps and have to deal with a horde of zombies that come from both sides meaning that unless you have cover which beats the porpuse of running through a bunch of zombies to get to a saferoom or some other area to run foward but that be due to me not being good at gaming but still a kinda of bother. If you are going to play with friends and theres an empty slot that is replaced with a bot the run will be 10x harder due to the incompetence of the bot because of the problems I've mentioned above.

My final answer will be a yes, do buy it the game despite everything relating to old source engine and other things it still has to be one of the greatest casual zombie games and beats most of the genre completly due to how fun the game is.

127488888.review:
I am fairly new to the Left 4 Dead series which has been a very well loved series for ages now. The game is still worth checking out despite its age, and the community is still very strong. These games go on deep discount often if you are curious about them, and if you are only going to play one of them, L4D2 includes the L4D1 campaigns in the game, so you’d be better off just getting L4D2.

You play as part of a team of 4 (Human or CPU teammates) fighting your way from safe house to safe house while encountering hordes of the infected (zombies). You will face 10 different types of enemies who will each attack you differently, as well as the common infected (basic zombies) attacking in a giant mob at times. So you will have to be prepared on how to handle each enemy type very quickly, since this is a very fast paced game.

The multiplayer comes with a lot of different modes, like campaign, versus, survival ect. In my short time with the game I’ve found some pretty fun and nice players, as well as some cry babies and jack wagons, as to be expected in any online multiplayer experience.

If you are playing with a controller and want to customize your controls, you will need to follow the steps listed in the QUALITY OF LIFE IMPROVEMENTS below, since LFD2 doesn’t save your controller settings for some reason, at least not as of April 2023. 

I found that equipping the “XBOX HUD Without The “Y” Icon Mod,” and making the Back/View used to enable voice chat to be a good start. With using “TAB” to start text chat, “y” to vote yes, and “n” to vote no, for the keyboard features. Adjust accordingly to your personal preferences.  

It’s a cool game, I already knew and loved Bill from Dead By Daylight, and I like Zoey because she looks very similar to Meg from Dead By Daylight. I also found myself liking Coach because he has a hunger for candy bars. Would recommend. 

QUALITY OF LIFE IMPROVEMENTS

*How To Save Your Controller Settings

Go to your “left4dead2/cfg” Folder

Open each of these files with Notepad, select all text, delete all text, and then save. DO NOT actually delete the file itself. 

360controller.cfg
autoexec.360.cfg
config.global.360.cfg
config_default.cfg
joy_preset_1.cfg
joy_preset_2.cfg
joy_preset_3.cfg
joy_preset_4.cfg
undo360controller.cfg

*Workshop Mods To Subscribe To

XBOX HUD Without The “Y” Icon
Lux’s Survivor Legs Script
Zoey Barefoot Mod
Boomer Fat Bastard
Tank Cena (John Cena)
Smoker Yoshi
Sexy Grunty (Witch)

130868718.review:
The Hog Rider card is unlocked from the Spell Valley (Arena 5). He is a very fast building-targeting, melee troop with moderately high hitpoints and damage. He appears just like his Clash of Clans counterpart; a man with brown eyebrows, a beard, a mohawk, and a golden body piercing in his left ear who is riding a hog. A Hog Rider card costs 4 Elixir to deploy.
Strategy
His fast move speed can boost forward mini tanks like an Ice Golem in a push. At the same time, he can also function as a tank for lower hitpoint troops such as Goblins as he still has a fair amount of health. Most cheap swarms complement the Hog Rider well, as they are nearly as fast as him and usually force more than one card out of the opponent's hand.
The Hog Rider struggles with swarms, as they can damage him down and defeat him quickly while obstructing his path. Barbarians in particular can fully counter him without very strict timing on the defender's part, though be wary of spells.
A Hunter can kill the Hog Rider in 2 hits if placed right on top of it. However, if you place something in front of the Hog Rider, the Hunter's splash will damage the Hog Rider and hit the card in front of it more.
The Hog Rider in conjunction with the Freeze can surprise the opponent and allow the Hog Rider to deal much more damage than anticipated, especially if the opponent's go-to counter is a swarm, or swarms are their only effective counter to him. Skeletons and Bats will immediately be defeated by the spell, while Spear Goblins, Goblins, and Minions will be at low enough health to be defeated by a follow up Zap or Giant Snowball.
However, this strategy isn't very effective against buildings as the Hog Rider will take a while to destroy the building, giving the opponent ample time to articulate another counter.
Against non-swarm troops, it can deal a lot of damage during the freeze time, but this can allow the opponent to set up a massive counterpush. For this reason, players should either only go for a Hog Rider + Freeze when they have other units backing it up from a counterattack, or if the match is about to end and they need to deal as much damage as possible.
It is not a good idea to send in a Hog Rider simply to destroy a building, especially if it is the only building targeting unit available, as defeating Crown Towers becomes substantially more difficult. Spells or simply waiting out the lifetime of the building are more effective. The exception to this is an Elixir Collector placed in front of the King's Tower. If a Hog Rider placed at the bridge, he can destroy the Collector for a positive Elixir trade, though the damage from both Princess Towers will usually mean he does not survive to deal any damage to them. However, if the opponent sends in defending troops, it can be an opportunity to gain spell damage value.
In a deck with several low-cost cards, it might be worth it to simply send the Hog Rider against one building. These decks shuffle their card rotation quick enough, that they will arrive to their next Hog Rider before the next building arrives in the opponent's card rotation.
Long-ranged troops like Musketeer and Flying Machine can snipe those buildings, preserving some of the Hog Rider's health, possibly allowing it to get some Tower damage.
When there are buildings placed in the middle to counter the Hog Rider, understanding the placement of the Hog Rider and the type of building placed can help the Hog Rider to bypass certain buildings.
Passive buildings such as spawners and Elixir Collector have a larger hitbox than defensive buildings; which means that if a passive building was placed 3 tiles away from the river in the middle of the opponent's side, then it is impossible for the Hog Rider to bypass that placement as the Hog Rider will get pulled to that building.
Defensive buildings have a smaller hitbox than a passive building, which means if that if a defensive building was placed three tiles away from the river in the middle of the opponent's side, a Hog Rider placed at the very left or right side of the Arena may be able to bypass it due to its smaller hitbox.
If the player has a building already placed down in the center of the arena, and the opponent tries to bypass it with a Hog Rider at the edge of the arena, they can use certain air troops to push the Hog Rider towards the building as it jumps over the river, effectively denying the bypass attempt. They must be already hovering over the correct placement, as very quick reflexes are required to correctly perform this technique.
For Bats, Skeleton Dragons, and Minion Horde, they should be placed right in front of the Hog Rider as soon as it is deployed.
For Minions, Skeleton Barrel, Mega Minion, Flying Machine, Electro Dragon, Baby Dragon, Inferno Dragon, Balloon, and Lava Hound, stagger the above placement one tile to the right if the Hog Rider is placed on the left side of the arena, and vice versa.
They can also use ground troops to achieve the same result. Something like an Ice Golem deployed at the Hog Rider’s landing spot will obstruct his path and force him to go around the unit, which causes him to be closer to the building instead of the Crown Tower.
The Hog Rider can kite Very Fast non-building targeting troops due to his own Very Fast speed and building only targeting if he is placed on the fourth tile from the bridge, slightly into the opposite lane. He can also stall grounded units when placed right at the bridge. He will pull them towards him while deploying, and then be untargetable by them when he jumps over the bridge. After landing, he will pull them back. This can be useful when the player needs to deal damage in the same lane they are defending. It will also help separate troops behind a tank in a large push.
A Tornado placed on the second tile front of the player's King's Tower and staggered two tiles towards the Princess Tower will activate it without any damage dealt to the Princess Tower, helping them in defending future pushes. This can also be a method of mitigating all damage dealt to a Princess Tower, but doing this more than three times may result in the King's Tower's health being low enough to be targeted directly, opening up the possible threat of a back door three crown. A better alternative is to pull the Hog away from the Princess Tower into the attacking range of all three Crown Towers, which will negate all damage as long as none of them are already distracted
A very powerful combo is the Hog Rider, the Musketeer, and the Valkyrie, typically referred to as the Trifecta. The Musketeer will defend against most troops, while the Valkyrie can protect her and the Hog Rider from swarms or high damage units. The Hog Rider is used to deal damage to the tower.
This can be effectively countered by Lightning, one-shotting the Musketeer and severely damaging both the Valkyrie and Hog Rider. The Minion Horde is also effective, but the enemy can Zap them and the Musketeer will one-shot them all. Even if the Musketeer is defeated, the Hog Rider and Valkyrie will have enough time to severely damage the Tower.
The Hog Rider should be placed behind the Valkyrie to give it a boost so that it stays in front of the Hog Rider, protecting it.

127588382.review:
This game is both increadibly good and frustratingly bad. For me personally the good aspects have been overpowering but I think that is only the case because I mainly played with friends, I am pretty sure that the game is a lot less fun solo.

The campains are great and you can spend a lot of time on them, especially when playing with friends. The bots are sadly pretty much useless and that is more and more a problem on higher difficulties. I installed a mod to help with that a tiny bit but am still not able to play solo with bots on higher than normal difficulty.
The gameplay is nice, you have normal hordes of zombies as well as special mutated with their own unique abilities. They spawn more or less randomly and add a bit more spice to the normal enemies.

There are multiple gamemodes, one is a surviver vs zombies one, where you play in a group against others in multiplayer. I've only played it with friends but i've heard that this is the mode that is most populated still. This mode is not too much fun in my personal opinion but if you enjoy dead by daylight and similar games i am sure you'd have fun with this as well.

So, in conclusion: this game is great in multiplayer, less so alone. If you have a grouop of friends to play this with it can be great!

137785027.review:
Well, well, well, if it isn't Left 4 Dead 2 – the game that takes the zombie apocalypse to a whole new level!

Let's start with what makes this game so darn special. The first thing that comes to mind is the AI Director – a genius system that ensures every playthrough is different and unpredictable. You never know what's going to happen next, which keeps things fresh and exciting.

And speaking of excitement, the gameplay is just nuts. You're thrown into the middle of a zombie apocalypse with just a few fellow survivors, and you have to fight your way through hordes of the undead to safety. The combat is intense and satisfying, and the variety of weapons and gadgets at your disposal is just plain awesome.

But what really sets Left 4 Dead 2 apart is the teamwork aspect. This is a game that's meant to be played with friends, and it's all about working together to survive. You'll need to watch each other's backs, share resources, and coordinate your attacks if you want to make it out alive.

And let's not forget about the zombies themselves. Left 4 Dead 2 is chock-full of unique and terrifying enemy types, each with their own strengths and weaknesses. The Smokers will grab you from a distance, the Hunters will pounce on you from above, and the Tanks...well, let's just say you do NOT want to mess with the Tanks.

Overall, Left 4 Dead 2 is a game that's not afraid to take risks and do things differently. From the AI Director to the teamwork to the terrifying enemies, this game is an absolute blast to play. If you're a fan of zombie games or just looking for something unique and exciting, then you need to give this game a try. Just don't forget to bring some friends along for the ride!

140131582.review:
Left 4 Dead 2, developed by Valve Corporation, is a thrilling cooperative first-person shooter that immerses players in the heart-pounding chaos of a zombie apocalypse. Building upon the success of its predecessor, Left 4 Dead 2 takes the intense and addictive gameplay formula to new heights. With its immersive atmosphere, strategic gameplay, diverse characters, and robust multiplayer modes, Left 4 Dead 2 delivers an unforgettable and adrenaline-fueled experience.

    Immersive and Intense Atmosphere:
    From the moment you step into the infected world of Left 4 Dead 2, you're immediately engulfed in a dark and atmospheric setting. The game's detailed environments, ranging from desolate city streets to eerie swamps, create a sense of impending doom and isolation. The haunting sound design, coupled with the game's dynamic AI Director, ensures that no two playthroughs are the same, heightening the tension and keeping players on the edge of their seats.

    Engaging Cooperative Gameplay:
    Left 4 Dead 2 excels in delivering cooperative gameplay that emphasizes teamwork and coordination. Whether playing with friends or AI-controlled teammates, the game requires players to work together to survive. Each of the four playable characters has unique strengths and weaknesses, encouraging strategic cooperation and role specialization. The necessity for constant communication and support adds depth to the gameplay, fostering a sense of camaraderie and shared survival.

    Variety of Infected Enemies:
    Left 4 Dead 2 offers an array of infected enemies, each presenting different challenges and strategies. From the agile and relentless Hunters to the hulking and armored Tanks, encountering the infected is always a thrilling and unpredictable experience. The special infected, such as the jockey and charger, introduce new dynamics to gameplay, forcing players to adapt on the fly. The variety and unpredictability of the infected keep players engaged and constantly on their toes.

    Dynamic AI Director:
    The game's dynamic AI Director is a standout feature that ensures no two playthroughs are alike. The Director adjusts the difficulty and pacing based on player performance, ramping up the tension and intensity when needed. This dynamic system creates a sense of unpredictability, making each playthrough feel fresh and challenging. Whether you're playing alone or with friends, the AI Director ensures a dynamic and engaging experience every time.

    Robust Multiplayer Modes:
    Left 4 Dead 2 offers a range of multiplayer modes that provide hours of competitive and cooperative gameplay. The cooperative campaign mode allows players to team up and battle through the game's gripping story together. The Versus mode introduces a thrilling competitive element, pitting two teams of players against each other, with one team assuming the role of the infected. The game's intense Versus mode, along with other modes like Survival and Scavenge, offers endless replayability and fierce multiplayer battles.

    Extensive Modding and Customization:
    Left 4 Dead 2 has a dedicated modding community that continually produces new content, keeping the game fresh and exciting. The Steam Workshop integration allows players to easily browse and install mods, custom campaigns, and new game modes created by the community. The ability to customize gameplay elements, including infected behavior and weapon modifications, adds depth and personalization to the experience, ensuring that players can tailor the game to their preferences.

    Longevity and Enduring Appeal:
    Left 4 Dead 2's enduring appeal is a testament to its exceptional gameplay and design. The game's challenging and addictive nature, coupled with its cooperative and competitive multiplayer modes, ensures that players keep coming back for more. The support from the modding community, regularly introducing new content and experiences, adds to the game's longevity and replay value.

Conclusion
Left 4 Dead 2 is a must-play title for fans of cooperative gameplay, intense action, and zombie survival scenarios. Its immersive atmosphere, strategic gameplay, diverse enemy types, robust multiplayer modes, extensive modding support, and enduring appeal make it a standout game in its genre.

The game's immersive atmosphere draws players into a world plagued by the undead. The detailed environments, combined with the haunting sound design, create a sense of desperation and urgency, amplifying the adrenaline-fueled experience. Whether it's fighting through a city overrun by infected or navigating treacherous swamps, the atmosphere keeps players on the edge of their seats, fully immersed in the post-apocalyptic world.

The cooperative gameplay in Left 4 Dead 2 shines brightly, emphasizing teamwork, communication, and coordination. Playing with friends or AI-controlled teammates requires strategizing and supporting each other to survive the relentless waves of infected. The unique abilities and strengths of each character add depth to the cooperative experience, encouraging players to work together and utilize their skills effectively.

The variety of infected enemies in the game keeps the gameplay fresh and exciting. Each enemy presents different challenges and requires different strategies to overcome. From the surprise pounce of the Hunter to the destructive force of the Tank, every encounter tests players' reflexes, decision-making, and ability to adapt on the fly. The inclusion of special infected further adds to the diversity of gameplay, constantly keeping players on their toes.

The dynamic AI Director is a standout feature that ensures replayability and unpredictable gameplay experiences. The AI Director adjusts the difficulty and pacing based on player performance, ensuring that every playthrough feels unique. This adaptive system adds tension and excitement, keeping players engaged and constantly challenged. The dynamic nature of the game guarantees that no two matches are ever the same, offering endless replayability.

Left 4 Dead 2's multiplayer modes are where the game truly shines. The cooperative campaign mode allows players to team up with friends and tackle the game's challenging missions together. The Versus mode introduces a competitive element, where two teams take turns playing as survivors and infected, creating intense battles and strategic gameplay. Other modes like Survival and Scavenge provide additional multiplayer experiences, ensuring there's something for everyone.

The game's extensive modding support and customization options add to its longevity. The dedicated modding community continually produces new content, ranging from custom campaigns to gameplay modifications. The ability to create and share mods through the Steam Workshop allows players to customize their gameplay experience, further extending the game's lifespan and providing endless possibilities for new challenges and experiences.

In conclusion, Left 4 Dead 2 stands as a pinnacle of cooperative multiplayer gaming, offering an immersive and pulse-pounding zombie survival experience. Its atmospheric world, strategic gameplay, diverse enemy types, robust multiplayer modes, extensive modding support, and enduring appeal make it a game that continues to captivate and entertain players even years after its release. If you're looking for an adrenaline-fueled cooperative shooter that delivers thrilling moments and intense teamwork, Left 4 Dead 2 is an absolute must-play. Gather your friends, arm yourselves, and prepare to fight for survival in this gripping zombie apocalypse.

142540998.review:
Left 4 Dead 2 is a phenomenal zombie apocalypse video game that is guaranteed to captivate gamers from start to finish. As a fan of the original Left 4 Dead, I was thrilled to dive into the sequel, and it did not disappoint! Valve has truly outdone themselves, creating an adrenaline-pumping experience that will leave you on the edge of your seat and begging for more.

One of the most remarkable aspects of Left 4 Dead 2 is the intense and immersive gameplay. With a vast array of diverse campaigns set in various environments, from abandoned cities to eerie swamps, each scenario offers a unique and challenging experience. The AI Director, an ingenious feature that dynamically adjusts the game's difficulty based on player performance, keeps you constantly engaged, ensuring that no two playthroughs are the same.

The character selection is another shining point in this game. Each survivor comes with their own distinct personality, making them instantly likable and relatable. Whether it's Coach's motivating speeches, Ellis's humorous anecdotes, Rochelle's calm demeanor, or Nick's sarcastic wit, you'll find yourself forming a bond with your virtual team.

Speaking of teamwork, Left 4 Dead 2 places a strong emphasis on cooperation, which is where the game truly shines. Working together with friends or other online players is an exhilarating experience, as you strategize, communicate, and watch each other's backs in the face of relentless hordes of infected. It fosters a sense of camaraderie that few other games can achieve, making it a perfect choice for cooperative gaming enthusiasts.

Moreover, the game's weapon variety and special infected are impressively well-balanced. From shotguns and sniper rifles to melee weapons like baseball bats and chainsaws, each tool of destruction feels satisfying to wield. The special infected, like the Hunter, Smoker, and Boomer, add a layer of unpredictability to the gameplay, keeping you on your toes at all times.

Graphically, Left 4 Dead 2 holds up exceptionally well. The environments are richly detailed, and the character animations are fluid and believable, which further enhances the immersive experience. Additionally, the sound design is top-notch, with the spine-chilling growls and moans of the infected heightening the tension as you navigate through the dark and dangerous world.

Finally, the game's longevity is extraordinary. Even after completing all the campaigns, the community-created content and custom campaigns available through the Steam Workshop ensure that the excitement never dies down. Valve's continuous support for the game over the years is a testament to their commitment to delivering a first-class gaming experience.

In conclusion, Left 4 Dead 2 is an absolute must-play for fans of survival horror and cooperative gaming. Its action-packed gameplay, diverse environments, memorable characters, and excellent replayability make it a timeless classic in the world of video games. Valve has set the bar high for zombie-themed games, and it's safe to say that Left 4 Dead 2 will remain a beloved favorite for years to come. Grab your weapons, team up with friends, and brace yourself for an unforgettable journey through the apocalypse!

Left 4 Dead 2 is one of the best coop games of all time. It is a simpler game compared to the majority of the modern ones, but it is that simplicity that makes the game so much fun, everyone can hop on and game without any problems aside from skill. But beware, even though the game is accessible, if playing on Expert difficulty be prepared to swear a lot and fight with your coop buddies on why you and them keep dying and failing a lot, which can be frustrating but so rewarding after finishing the campaign and its stages.

Valve did a great job on improving on a classic, and the Last Stand Update improves on it even more.

[b]Title:[/b] Enjoyable but in Need of Major Fixes for Playability
[b]Rating:[/b] ⭐⭐☆☆☆

The classic game from 2009 still offers an enjoyable gaming experience, with [b]solid core gameplay[/b] that appeals to those seeking nostalgic moments. However, it faces several notable issues in 2023:

[b]Pros:[/b]
- The [b]core gameplay remains solid and enjoyable[/b], making it a great choice for those looking to relive classic gaming nostalgia.

[b]Cons:[/b]
1. [b]Missing Material and Models:[/b] A significant drawback is the presence of numerous missing material and models, which have gone unaddressed for a long time, affecting overall immersion and enjoyment.

2. [b]Black Screen Issue on Latest Windows:[/b] Running the game on modern Windows OS can be frustrating due to a persistent black screen problem, even after multiple reinstallations and configuration tweaks, which is disappointing in an era emphasizing compatibility.

3. [b]4 Player Limit:[/b] The game's 4-player limit feels outdated in today's multiplayer gaming landscape, where larger groups are common. Expanding this limit would improve the game's appeal and longevity.

Being a paid game, developers have a greater responsibility to address these issues as players expect a polished experience. If it were free, some issues might be more forgivable. In summary, the game's [b]core gameplay is enjoyable[/b], but the developers must resolve issues like missing content, the black screen problem on modern Windows systems, and the limited player count to reach its full potential.

128116313.review: Great game that brings back a lot of memories from when I played it when it came out on Xbox360. There's a lot of new features compared to when it first game out and I couldn't be happier with the results. One of the very few coop zombie games that does it right, thank you Valve. The only issue I'd say there is within the game would be the player base not being so friendly to newcomers, which is quite understandable considering they happen to mess with the flow of the game that all experienced players are used to. There is a massive learning curve within the multiplayer scene of this game and all I'd say is to tread lightly because one mistake can lead to someone calling a votekick on you almost simultaneously. I recommend for all the newcomers and people getting this game due to sales that you watch Ironbeard guides or something similar to truly understand the flow and dynamic of not just the game but the player base as well. I hope everyone comes to love this game just as much as I do it's worth every hour.

left 4 dead 2 is a co-op shooter where you fight through levels filled with zombies. the combat in left 4 dead 2 is in every way an improvement over the first game, giving you a much larger array of weapons to choose from, with the added addition of melee weapons that provide you much more choice and variety keeping the gameplay fresh and more varied. there is also the addition of the uncommon infected, regular zombies that have unique abilities, such as clown zombies that attract other zombies to it, armoured zombies that have to be attacked from behind, along with a variety of others. this brings more variety to the gameplay with not all zombies acting exactly the same causing you to think about how to take out certain ones or which ones you should focus first, rather than just having every zombie be exactly the same and being able to run through them all without thinking. this game is a massive improvement over the original in basically every way. definitely one of the greatest games of all time and one of the greatest sequels ever.

131606502.review: Left 4 Dead 2 is an immensely popular survival horror game developed by Valve Corporation. Launched in 2009, the game has stood the test of time and still remains a favorite among gamers worldwide. In this essay, we will explore the reasons why Left 4 Dead 2 is considered by many to be the best game ever made. One of the most notable features of Left 4 Dead 2 is its incredibly immersive gameplay. Playing as one of the four survivors caught in a zombie apocalypse, your objective is to stay alive while fighting off hordes of zombies. The game's unique AI Director system constantly adjusts the gameplay to provide fresh challenges, making each playthrough a unique experience. Due to the random nature of the AI Director system mentioned earlier, Left 4 Dead 2 has unparalleled replay value. Even if you have completed the game multiple times, each playthrough is different and offers new challenges and opportunities for exploration. This keeps the game fresh and exciting no matter how many times you've played it. Left 4 Dead 2 is an excellent co-op game that encourages teamwork and communication. Playing with friends or strangers online allows you to strategize and coordinate your efforts to survive the zombie onslaught. Whether you're defending your position or trying to escape, co-op gameplay is a thrilling experience. Each of the four characters in Left 4 Dead 2 has a unique personality and backstory, adding depth to the gameplay. You'll find yourself growing attached to your chosen survivor and wanting to see them survive. Additionally, each character has a different set of skills and strengths, allowing for versatile gameplay and multiple playstyles. The game's weapons are creative and effective. From shotguns to chainsaws, grenades to frying pans, there is always a weapon that fits your playstyle. The game also encourages experimentation with weapon combos, which can lead to unique and satisfying kills. Left 4 Dead 2 is not an easy game. The AI Director system and hordes of zombie waves ensure that players are always on their toes, making the game an intense challenge. Surviving a particularly tough segment or executing a daring escape can provide a sense of accomplishment unlike any other game. The game's environments are varied and unique, ranging from an abandoned amusement park to a swamp infested with zombies. Each level poses new environmental challenges and opportunities for strategy. This variety keeps the gameplay fresh and interesting. The AI in Left 4 Dead 2 is advanced and dynamic. The zombies behave intelligently, flanking you and using teamwork to overcome your defenses. This makes the game's combat intense and unpredictable, keeping you on the edge of your seat at all times. We've touched on this before, but it's worth mentioning again. The replay value of Left 4 Dead 2 cannot be overstated. Whether you're playing solo or with friends, each playthrough presents new challenges and opportunities for exploration. The game's random nature ensures that it never gets old. Left 4 Dead 2 gives players the freedom to choose their own path. You can prioritize survival, exploration, or combat, depending on your playstyle. The game's versatility means that no two playthroughs are the same. The modding community for Left 4 Dead 2 is vibrant and active. Players create new skins, weapons, and even entire campaigns, providing endless opportunities for customization and variation. Left 4 Dead 2 is accessible to players of all levels of experience. The game's easy-to-learn mechanics and forgiving respawn system ensures that even new players can have fun and contribute to the team. The game has many set piece moments that are both thrilling and memorable. Escaping a burning skyscraper or surviving a horde during a rainstorm are just a few examples. These moments add to the game's immersive storytelling and provide unforgettable experiences. Each of the game's campaigns can be replayed multiple times, with different options for difficulty and pacing. Whether you're playing on Easy or Expert mode, each campaign offers a unique and challenging experience. Finishing a campaign in Left 4 Dead 2, especially on higher difficulties, provides a powerful sense of accomplishment. Surviving a campaign is not easy, and players who manage to do so can feel proud of themselves. Left 4 Dead 2's multiplayer components are diverse and exciting. Playing as the infected in Versus mode adds a whole new level of gameplay depth, while Scavenge mode encourages team cooperation and defense. The game's world feels alive and dynamic, with zombies and other dangers lurking around every corner. The game's AI Director ensures that the gameplay is always unpredictable, adding to the immersive atmosphere. The sound design in Left 4 Dead 2 is brilliant, adding to the game's immersive experience. The moans and groans of the zombies and the sound of gunfire create a tense and atmospheric environment, immersing the player in the game's world. The game's characters have become iconic in the gaming community. From Coach's southern charm to Ellis's comic relief, each character is memorable and unique. Left 4 Dead 2 expertly blends elements of horror and humor, creating a unique and memorable gaming experience. The game's humor brings levity to tense situations while the horror creates a sense of urgency and danger. The game's mechanics are smooth and responsive, making combat feel satisfying and fluid. The game also has an intuitive control system that eases players into the gameplay quickly. Left 4 Dead 2 allows cross-platform play between PC and Xbox gamers, creating a larger and more diverse player base. The game's unique power-ups add to the sense of adventure and exploration. Adrenaline shots and health kits can be found throughout the game, creating opportunities for strategic planning. Playing as the infected in Versus mode is a unique and thrilling experience. The infected offer different gameplay mechanics and strategies, making Versus mode a fresh and exciting addition to the game. Left 4 Dead 2 allows for customizable controls, making it easier for players to tailor their playstyle to their preferences. Players quickly become emotionally invested in their characters, creating a sense of attachment and urgency to keep them alive. The game's storyline is engaging and unique, offering a new take on the zombie apocalypse trope. The game's storytelling and atmosphere create an immersive and unforgettable experience. While the game is accessible to new players, it also has a steep learning curve for those looking for a greater challenge. The game rewards players who take the time to master its mechanics and strategies. In conclusion, Left 4 Dead 2 is considered by many to be the best game ever made due to its immersive gameplay, replay value, co-op gameplay, versatile characters, creative weapons, intense difficulty, varied environments, advanced AI, high replay value, player choice, modding community, accessibility, set piece moments, replayability of campaigns, a sense of accomplishment, multiplayer components, living world, ambient sound design, iconic characters, a unique blend of horror and humor, smooth game mechanics, cross-platform play, unique power-ups, the infected, customizable controls, emotional investment, engaging storyline, and steep learning curve. Its longevity and continued popularity speak to its status as a classic game that will continue to captivate gamers for years to come.

123590022.review:
plants vs zombies except it's not a video game, developed by PopCap Games, a subsidiary of Electronic Arts (EA). The series follows the affiliates of David "Crazy Dave" Blazing as they use his plants to defend against a zombie invasion, led by Doctor Edgar Zomboss. On April 1, 2009, PopCap released a music video for the song "Zombies on your Lawn" to promote Plants vs. Zombies. A PopCap spokesperson, Garth Chouteau, revealed in an IGN interview that Plants vs. Zombies would be released soon on PC and Mac. On April 22, 2009, PopCap released an official game trailer of Plants vs. Zombies on YouTube. During the promotion of Plants vs. Zombies, PopCap released a demo version of the game that could be played for thirty minutes.[5] Plants vs. Zombies was officially released on May 5, 2009, for PC and Mac.

PopCap Games and its assets were bought by EA on July 12, 2011, for 750 million dollars.[7] Fifty employees were laid off in the Seattle studio of PopCap Games on August 21, 2012, to mark a switch of focus to mobile and social gaming.

On August 20, 2012, PopCap announced that they were working on a sequel to Plants vs. Zombies. Its release date would be set at late spring of 2013. However, the game's status was in doubt shortly after the announcement when the company went through a period of layoffs.

In May 2013, PopCap Games released a trailer revealing a sequel to the first game, titled Plants vs. Zombies 2: It's About Time. The game was soft-launched for the iOS in Australia and New Zealand on July 10, 2013, and was officially released on August 14, 2013, as a freemium title. The game featured new locations and plants along with the addition of plant food, a power-up that can be used to enhance a plant for a short period and can either be bought using in-game currency or acquired by defeating zombies that are glowing green.

In July 2019, EA announced Plants vs. Zombies 3, another free-to-play mobile title in the series. It was launched in a pre-alpha state for Android in July 2019. The game soft-launched in February 2020 in the Philippines, Romania, and Ireland. It was then made unavailable in October 2020, becoming unplayable in November 2020. EA has plans to release an improved version of the game in the future. On September 7, 2021, Plants vs. Zombies 3 was soft launched again with substantial changes, such as two-dimensional graphics and the return of the Sunflower as a plantable plant, having the same purpose in the previous iterations.

A spin-off called Plants vs. Zombies Adventures was announced in March 2013 and was released on May 20, 2013, on Facebook. The game added new locations and new plants. It also had a gameplay feature in which the player had a limited amount of plants and had to grow more plants at an in-game farm. In July 2014, it was announced that Plants vs. Zombies Adventures would close on October 12, 2014.

Plants vs. Zombies: Garden Warfare was announced at E3 2013 as a multiplayer third-person shooter game made for PC and consoles. Plants vs. Zombies: Garden Warfare was released on February 25, 2014, in North America and on February 27, 2014, in Europe. A sequel, Plants vs. Zombies: Garden Warfare 2, was teased in June 2015 and was officially announced at E3 2015. The game was released on February 23, 2016. On March 10, 2016, PopCap announced Plants vs. Zombies Heroes, a digital collectible card game in the style of tower defense. It was soft released to certain countries on the same day, and was fully released internationally on October 18, 2016.

In August 2019, a closed beta of a sequel to Plants vs. Zombies: Garden Warfare 2 codenamed "Picnic" was made available to select players through invites. And on September 4, 2019, EA announced the sequel's title; Plants vs. Zombies: Battle for Neighborville. It was released in an early access state that same date. The game was fully released on October 18, 2019.

7742648.review:
Even though this game is over 9 years old it still holds up as being one of, if not THE best zombie game on the market. It's not only fun playing single player but it's hilarious when you can get three more friends to join in the zombie killing.

There's of course the standard Easy - Hard difficulities (Here being Easy, Medium, Advanced and Expert). So if you're looking for some mindless slaughtering to do you can put it on easy or if you and your friends is a tatical squad preparing for the zombie apacolypse this is a great way to start!

Also you don't have to play the first game to get into this one, all the maps and more from the first game is in this one. Even if you want to play oldschool there is a mode for that. Speaking of modes, there's Versus mode which is exactly what it sounds like, you control both the infected and the survivors in rounds. The one who ends the final map with the most points win. There is also a realism version of this mode which means the survivers can't see the green/orange/red glow around them as they used to.

There's also Survival which is aslo what it sounds like. Survive for X amount of time and you get bronze, silver or a gold medal depending on the requirments for the map you're playing.

Scavanger is the last major gamemode, here you play as survivor and infected and the objective is to fill a generator with gas. Who wins depends on which team's the fastest.

Then, finally, there's something called mutation. These are pretty much fun little mini modes. For example you have to try and survive an entire campaign on your own, you and all your teamates have katanas and can't get other weapons, you need to carry around a lawngnome to win etc.

The world is heading into the abyss of hell, and our 4 new heroes are trying to get on the last flight to go to their cherished house - refuge. If you opened this review of the game, but did not play the previous part, I advise you to play it and read my review on it - after all, in the second part, the developers did the impossible - namely, they made the game different, but still the same exciting game, in which the dark tone of the world has changed from the first part to the sun and drive, which is felt not only in the characters of the heroes, but also in the music, for which the developers have created even a virtual group within the game, with amazing tracks, where each note gives no longer a choir games as it was in the first part, but something different, sunnier, with the drive of life and inspires the hope that if around you hell, there you were with faithful friends! 
So take your friends and plunge into this world of hell zombies (more species of especially infected are waiting for you!), From which you don’t want to leave before dawn. In the second part, new companies are waiting for us, which are filled with the drive of rock and the sun, and a different atmosphere in relation to the first part. But despite this, both parts turned out so well that the developers took the companies from the first part, added them to the new version of the Source Engine, where you have not only more weapons, but also more especially infected enemies, for which you You can play multiplayer battles 4 on 4.

If after many hours of the game you feel that you want more from this powerful engine and this world of the game, then to your attention is a library from the Steam Workshop, which contains 1000 different modifications from a simple weapon skin change to a large-scale changes of everything you want, and if something is not found, then maybe soon I will see your modification in the top of the best :)
